attributes.action: Link Local Housing Allowance rates to actual private rent prices.
attributes.background: People on lower incomes that have to rent suitable housing privately are finding substantial shortfalls between rents and LHA, even with the cheapest of houses. Council tenants in the same circumstances have all their rent paid. This is not fair.
attributes.additional_details: e.g.: A family of 4 in 3 bed ex Council terraced house, Chalvedon Estate, Pitsea, Basildon. An area classified as being an area of multiple deprivations by the ONS. Average rent £1000 pcm. LHA: £815 pcm. This means a shortfall of £285 pcm. A family of 4 in exactly the same house owned by the Council... no shortfall!

attributes.action: Fully regulate Student Loans Company, with reform of the repayment process.
attributes.background: Many graduates have been left thousands of pounds short by an administrative process that is not fit for purpose. This petition calls on the Government to reform the repayment process and regulate Student Loans Company in line with retail lenders.
attributes.additional_details:
Graduates leave education with thousands of pounds worth of debt that is repaid via their payslips. The money is collected by HMRC and passed to Student Loans Company annually to be credited to the outstanding balance.

Current arrangements mean that money is frequently not credited to the loan, despite being paid by the graduate. This means it can take longer to repay a student loan, while interest is accrued.

HMRC and SLC do not to have mechanisms to check/rectify mistakes in a timely manner.

attributes.action: Increase verification to decrease the fraud in scrapping a stolen vehicle.
attributes.background:
Vehicles presented for scrapping by a thief can currently disappear if no V5 is presented on arrival at the scrapyard.
There is no electronic information or cross checking link between DVLA and police forces in the UK.
Remove the facility of cashing the cheque to the thief by the scrapyard.
attributes.additional_details: This follows an incident with a rare vehicle which after being stolen, disappeared, was effectively crushed, and all that happened before any checks could be made.

attributes.action: Revise section 59 and withdraw the photographer / Car Spotter 48 hour ban/fine
attributes.background: Section 59 is being abused by officers, it is used to threaten high powered supercar owners. The Police Reform Act needs to be revised and officers reminded on how to use there authority. Also car spotters should not face any ban or fine due to the actions of drivers and should be left alone.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been 2 cases of police issuing bans to car spotters and i feel that it is assured, anyone has the right to take a picture. Even so there may be tourists who have flown in and may simply want to take a picture of a luxurious sports car to then face a ban in a well known tourist attraction with a fine. Also in the papers wealthy luxurious have been finding there stay here very troubling and unwelcoming as the police have been stopping them purely for the fact that they can.  

NOCKAM

attributes.action: Abolish the banned dog breed list
attributes.background: The banned dog breed list is inhumane against the dogs on it. The police can seize a dog if they think it is a Pitbull. So any cross Staffie could be classed as a pitbull in the police's eyes. No dog is aggressive unless the owner makes them. The owners are to blame not the dog.
attributes.additional_details:
Banned dogs
In the UK, it’s against the law to own certain types of dog. These are the:

Pit Bull Terrier
Japanese Tosa
Dogo Argentino
Fila Braziliero

If your dog matches many of the characteristics of a Pit Bull Terrier, it may be a banned type.
A police or council dog expert will judge what type of dog you have and it will be kept in kennels while the police (or council) apply to a court
You’re not allowed to visit your dog while you wait for the court decision.

attributes.action: Increase penalty for animal cruelty
attributes.background: Anyone found guilty of causing injury/harm/suffering/neglect towards an animal should face a minimum prison sentence of 6 months and banned from owning any animal and a register made of all convicted persons

attributes.action: Produce a clear and costed plan on Brexit before triggering Article 50
attributes.background: Whichever way we voted - leave or remain - we the undersigned, demand that Article 50 is not triggered until there is a clear and costed plan. The U.K's citizens have a right to understand the true implications of leaving the EU before it is legally set in stone.
attributes.additional_details:
What is Article 50?

Article 50 is the technical part of the EU treaty that triggers the withdrawal process from the European Union. 

It's the point of no return.

attributes.action: Build a new Royal Yacht Britannia with British Steel, Workers & apprentices.
attributes.background:
Following the EU referendum, we should build a new Royal Yacht Britannia using British Steel, British Workers and training British apprentices. 

Britannia would be a Flag Ship for a newly invigorated Britain sailing the oceans of the world promoting the UK globally as a free trading nation.
attributes.additional_details: This is a perfect opportunity to invest British money in a project that will create British jobs, train British apprentices and produce a fully British product.  The Royal family will once again be able to showcase British engineering and design at its best whilst visiting countries all over the world establishing and building relationships that will pave the way for trade deals with our Global partners.

attributes.action: Don't cancel the British EU Referendum
attributes.background: In response to the petition "Cancel the planned referendum on Britain's continued membership of the EU" which is fundamentally an affront to the ability of the people to exercise their democratic will. Leave or Remain please show your support for a democratic process that enfranchises the people

attributes.action: A Parliamentary review of the 2005 Change to the Double Jeopardy Law.
attributes.background: We believe the operation of the change in the the DJ law is not working as Parliament intended. We cite the example of Matthew Hamlen, a 37 year old electrician, and a married man with a son, currently in the custody of HMPS in the UK having been sentenced to 30 years imprisonment in February 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
Matthew has strenuously and consistently denied any involvement both before and during his original trial in 2011/2012 , at which he was unanimously acquitted by the jury, and his later ‘double jeopardy’ trial in January and Feb  2016.

https://matthewhamlenisinnocent.wordpress.com

attributes.action: More funding and awareness of mental health issues in young adults
attributes.background: After many friends suffering from mental health issues, I felt that this was an important topic, as mental health is often seen as inferior to physical illnesses

attributes.action: Ehler Danlos Syndrome NEEDS doctors knowledge! FUND IT!
attributes.background: Ehlers Danlos Syndrome has different types, the common link between them is Pain. Most people affected by this illness aren't diagnosed until later on in their lives.It is mostly an invisible illness and can ruin your life completely. THERE IS NO CURE! Most doctors don't know what it is.#makeachange
attributes.additional_details: I suffer from ehler danlos syndrome and life is hard at the best of times, when something goes wrong you would think a doctor to know at least a bit of background about it. NOT EDS! This is horrifying as so many people go undiagnosed and refused the help they need to manage it! Not all of us with EDS can make it to America for treatment so we need something set up to help people in the 🇬🇧. Every time a doctor says "i don't know what that is" it saddens me. Please help to change this😔

attributes.action: Create a law that new buildings must have roofs covered in solar panels/plants.
attributes.background: Partially covering roofs with solar panels would help to reduce the building's carbon footprint. The plants would be used on roofs which don't face south. The plants would produce oxygen and also reduce the amount of energy needed to heat or cool a building and also create a place for birds to nest.
attributes.additional_details:
Similar laws have been put in place in San Fransisco and France. It is more cost effective to do this on new buildings than retrofit existing buildings.
For more information:
https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/mar/20/france-decrees-new-rooftops-must-be-covered-in-plants-or-solar-panels

https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2016/apr/21/san-francisco-adopts-law-requiring-solar-panels-on-all-new-buildings

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for recreational use by over 16s
attributes.background: Cannabis has been a Class B drug in the UK since 2009, meaning that it's illegal to sell, distribute, or use the drug in any way. However, millions of people throughout the UK still take advantage of cannabis for their recreational use, often turning to backstreet dealers who are making thousands.
attributes.additional_details:
If cannabis was commercially available in UK pharmacies & supermarkets, not only would British businesses profit massively, but the VAT attached would make millions of pounds for the UK economy, which could be spent on things such as a better-funded NHS & more modern facilities for our schools. 

Cannabis has often been branded as bad for one's health, when in reality, it often soothes anxiety; prevents glaucoma; and doesn't have a harmful effect on your organs like tobacco & alcohol can.

attributes.action: A referendum on an elected House of Lords and a proportional representation.
attributes.background: In the recent referendum on membership of the EU, one of the key arguments revolved around democracy and the role of unelected officials in law making processes. The U.K. has 800 unelected officials in the legislative process, and a voting system that does not accurately represent citizen's views.

attributes.action: Say No to an "Independence Day" Bank Holiday on 23rd June.
attributes.background:
Nigel Farage has called for the 23rd of June to be celebrated as the UK's "Independence Day", and that the date should be a Bank Holiday.

We the undersigned feel that Mr. Farage should not be rewarded in this fashion for his actions in the EU Referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
A Bank Holiday bearing Mr. Farage's name would be giving too much publicity to a man who has misled the electorate on multiple occasions, and who behaved despicably with regard to the "Breaking Point" poster.

This Bank Holiday would also be offensive to the 16.1m voters who voted to remain a part of the European Union, and who would not want be reminded of this fact every year.

attributes.action: Guarantee a minimum standard of contraceptive availability across the UK
attributes.background: The Independent and BBC report that funding cuts have caused some GPs to stop providing the contraceptive coil, IUD and contraceptive implant. It makes no sense to reduce access to cost-effective, proven modern contraceptive innovations; local authorities must receive adequate funds to provide this.
attributes.additional_details: Access to a full range of contraception prevents pregnancy (abortions and raising unplanned children are both more costly) and is vital for managing many health problems (thyroid malfunction, severe migraine/period pain, endometriosis). Government must a) require ring-fenced, guaranteed contraceptive funding (and reinstate provisions where cut) b) enforce minimum provisions: amount of options discussed with patients and available within a certain distance, and availability of long-acting methods

attributes.action: Reduce waiting times for domestic abuse and sexual assault counselling services.
attributes.background: The waiting list for counselling services following sexual assault or abuse is usually around 4 months for an assessment alone. Rape Crisis centres are experiencing more and more requests for support. Nearly a million people are raped every year, but in the last few years have had their funding cut.
attributes.additional_details:
Sexual assault and abuse are often seen as taboo and not spoken about. Many survivors suffer in silence, unable to get the help they need to recover. These types of crimes have the lowest conviction rates making survivors unable to speak up.

In my own and friends' experiences, people with PTSD are often turned away from most mental health services, including the NHS. Most of the UK do not have access to a Rape Crisis centre. This needs to change.

http://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php

attributes.action: Take fluffy bedding for hamsters off the shelves! It's dangerous!
attributes.background: In January 2016, I bought my first hamster & I now have 6! During this short time of owning hamsters I have observed posts on hamster forums  regarding the dangers of fluffy bedding. This bedding can cause serious injury & even fatality to a hamster as a direct consequence of using it.
attributes.additional_details:
Respiratory issues - If this bedding enters the hamsters lungs it can cause infection. In many cases this isn't curable & will lead to death. 

Blockages - If the hamster was to consume the bedding, and it is very possible, it can not be digested. This will lead to blockages within the hamsters system that can not be dislodge.

Limbs - The most common cause of injury regarding fluffy bedding is limb trapping. The bedding can trap the limbs within its fine strands resulting in amputation.

attributes.action: Make Boris Johnson apologise to the People of Egypt for his untrue comments.
attributes.background:
We, the British people that are living in or visiting Egypt on a regular basis request that Boris Johnson apologise for saying that there is a burgeoning crisis in Egypt, when it is not true. 
We are living and visiting the country happily and safely, please come and visit us and see for yourself.
attributes.additional_details: There are numerous British expats here in Egypt that can confirm that his comments are not true.

attributes.action: Call a referendum on HS2
attributes.background: The establishment has discovered that its opinion on the future of the EU is not aligned with the majority of the British public.  It is very likely that their view on the need for HS2 is also not aligned with the British Public.  Hold a referendum on HS2 so the public can decide.
attributes.additional_details: This is not a petition about stopping development of necessary infrastructure and destroying communities along the way, but one about the potentially unnecessary expenditure of tens of billions of pounds equivalent to 6 years of savings made by leaving the EU.  Other options have not been considered such as double decker trains.  There are double decker options that can fit under most existing tunnels by using space under the train too.  There is also video conferencing!

attributes.action: Cuts to Local Authority Housing Budgets must be stopped, reviewed and increased.
attributes.background: More and more people are living in poor quality social housing. I visited a family recently who were given a 3 bedroom flat to live in temporarily until a permanent home was found for them. I have photos of the appalling condition of this property in Rochdale. This is happening across the UK.
attributes.additional_details: The property let to the family I visited was filthy, I have photos to prove this, there was no wallpaper on the hall and stairs leading up to the flat. Instead it had graffiti on the walls, plaster that looked liked it had been put on with someones fingers, holes in the walls, mould on the floors and walls, dirt inside kitchen cupboards. Surely properties should be in a better state than this? More money needs to be given for local authorities to give homes to people in a fit state.

attributes.action: Change the age of the 30hrs free childcare to start at age 1 for working parents
attributes.background: The government are increasing the childcare hours from 15 to 30 for 3 and 4 year olds, but we as working parents are still struggling to pay for childcare for our babies as most women return to work after 9 months.  We want the age changed to start the 30hrs from the age of 1.

attributes.action: Start teaching children in schools about mental health
attributes.background:
In schools children are taught about sex education but never about mental health - why not? 

Large percentages of the population are affected by mental illness themselves or are subject to it some way. Make sure people are aware of warning signs/symptoms from a young age in order to help others.
attributes.additional_details: 10% of children and young people (aged 5-16 years) have a clinically diagnosable mental problem, yet 70% of children and adolescents who experience mental health problems have not had appropriate interventions at a sufficiently early age. (https://www.mentalhealth.org.uk/statistics/mental-health-statistics-children-and-young-people)

attributes.action: Decisions must be issued within 6 months after asylum is claimed
attributes.background:
We deplore the fact that the Home Office is failing to issue decisions about the future of asylum seekers in a timely manner. 
It is clear that many clients are waiting over a year, which contravenes EU guidelines and poses a breach of their human rights.
attributes.additional_details:
We ask the Home Office to obey their own guidelines which state that a decision will be made within 6 months after an asylum claim is made, and not the years many are experiencing today.
These people have fled to this country for political or religious reasons and are desperate to work, study and find their own home. They are prevented from doing this while waiting long overdue decisions by the Home Office. 
As a direct result, many suffer from mental health issues including stress, depression, sleeplessness, anxiety and physical problems. 
We therefore call on the Home Office to do everything in their power to give decisions within six months and to issue regular reports on the proportion of cases in which this is achieved.

attributes.action: Regulate and license air rifles in the same way as other fire arms.
attributes.background: After being shot by an air rifle in a residential area, our family pet was paralysed when the pellet lodged in his spine he died of his injuries. My children play in the same garden this horrific act of cruelty took place we ask for tighter rules for fear of further tragedy to ours or other families
attributes.additional_details: Currently UK law states that no one under the age of 18 is allowed to buy, shoot or handle an air rifle and that they must be locked away in a robust cupboard and pellets ideally kept separately.  Clearly though this does not deter improper use of rifles and irresponsible users to shoot where serious, injury, maiming or even death can occur.

attributes.action: Stop air strikes in Syria and Iraq.
attributes.background: The UK's involvement in military action endangers the lives of innocent civilians in the Middle East and here in Britain where we lay ourselves open to terrorist action. The millions spent on war could be better used to come to the aid of the desperate refugees displaced by conflict.
attributes.additional_details: So called Islamic State are clearly making life hell for the people in the territories they have occupied but by dropping bombs we are only adding to their misery. We are falling into the narrative that Isis has written for us. How can we possibly condemn terrorism whilst murdering innocent people ourselves? It is nonsensical.

attributes.action: Allow enlisted men to bear arms around the clock for personal protection in UK
attributes.background:
Our serving military should be allowed to carry sidearms at all times for self defense and for national security so they may act without hesitation to any terrorist threat to themselves or our nation
Our military are trained and are under oath to serve and protect our nation!
Please sign and share
attributes.additional_details:
No more attacks on our protectors like the horrific killing of Fusilier Lee Rigby RIP
Stop the attempted abductions of our serving men and women.
Give our heros the chance to protect themselves along with protecting our nation.

attributes.action: Ask the Government to set out clear proposals for leaving the EU
attributes.background:
We have voted to leave the EU,
BUT we have been given no clear idea of the Government's plans for
1. Our future trading relationships with the rest of the world;
2. Meeting the wishes of dissident parts of the UK.
These plans should be submitted for ratification by the public or Parliament.

attributes.action: Replace 5p plastic bags for PAPER BAGS.
attributes.background:
We, students at the School of Social and Behavioural Sciences at Kingston University, would like to see the offer of plastic bags by supermarkets and shopping outlets replaced by PAPER bags instead.
Paper bags can be very sturdy and are eco-friendly. 
Please, join us in our campaign.
attributes.additional_details:
We are also having a competition of art work based on Paper Bags, which will be exhibited at Stanley Picker Gallery (London).
More details about will be available at our Twitter account: @PaperBagsKU

attributes.action: Make sex work a protected characteristic under the Equality Act
attributes.background: The 2010 Equality Act does not include sex workers e.g. escorts, strippers, and porn actors, as a protected characteristic. Former sex workers can be discriminated against at work e.g. teachers may be fired if their past is exposed, despite it not impacting their ability to do their job.
attributes.additional_details:
A large number of sex workers are also women, LGBT+ (particularly transgender), disabled or belong to an ethnic minority. While these characteristics are protected, the fact that a disproportionate amount of sex workers belong to vulnerable groups means that they are still indirectly disadvantaged in the workplace.

For more info on sex work in the UK: http://prostitutescollective.net/

The Equality Act and discrimination:
https://www.gov.uk/discrimination-your-rights/types-of-discrimination

attributes.action: Abolish vat and council tax
attributes.background: Vat and council got introduced after we joined the European Union. No we are leaving it should be removed from citizens in the uk.

attributes.action: Make the placing and/or using of all snare traps illegal.
attributes.background: The frantic struggles of the trapped animal cause the snare wire to knot so that it tightens and the animal dies of strangulation. This barbaric practice not only traps & kills foxes, which it is designed for, it also kills other wildlife (badgers, otters) & peoples pets too.
attributes.additional_details:
Snare trapping involves setting a stiff but flexible steel wire in the shape of a crude noose on an animal trail. The wire is staked in the ground or attached to fence posts. A (legal) free-running snare is supposed to slacken when the animal stops struggling, however a rusted, kinked or knotted snare effectively becomes self-locking.

If any snares remain legal, then it is harder to enforce the law against illegal snares or against illegal use of legal snares.

attributes.action: Call for a UK referendum on the abolition of the "unelected" UK monarchy.
attributes.background: We have elected to leave the EU. One of the many arguments for the case of the UK leaving was to disconnect ourselves from the influence of unelected officials making choices on our behalf. So why stop with the EU? Let us now have a referendum on the relevance of the monarchy in our new modern UK.

attributes.action: Enforce equal and nondiscriminatory insurance policies for young drivers.
attributes.background: Young drivers aged 18+ face extremely unfair and ridiculous insurance fees for car insurance. These vary from £10,000 to well over £50,000, often costing 4/5 times the price of a car itself. How is it i am mature enough to have two jobs whilst attending college, but not drive a car affordably.
attributes.additional_details: Insurance companies are exploiting young drivers at rates which many can not afford. This behaviour goes completely against the whole notion of equality which Britain prides itself upon and discriminates heavily against the young and disabled preventing them from having equal opportunities in life as those who are older.

attributes.action: Raise the issue of the Taiji Dolphin slaughters with the Japanese Government
attributes.background: I've been horrified to learn & witness that every year in Taiji,Japan, dolphins are chased into a small cover and butchered in the most horrific and cruel way imaginable. The hunts are subsidized by the dolphin captivity industry,for a few "show quality' dolphins that are ripped from their families.
attributes.additional_details: People across the world have been shocked by this act of cruelty that is live streamed by many welfare organisation to raise awareness, e.g. dolphin project, sea shepherd,racing against extinction etc. This year the order book for Taiji is 150 dolphins for captivity, anymore captured will be killed. The world is watching and speaking out against Taiji but Governments continue to ignore their people. We ask, when will someone in power step forward and end this horrific act before its too late.

attributes.action: Stronger penalties for bullying, harassment and hate crime in the workplace.
attributes.background:
All of the above costs the UK economy loss of monies. It adversely impacts on the victim's career, physical and mental health and personal life. 

As per NHS choices one of the causes of suicide is bullying.
attributes.additional_details: The victim's voice is often lost. There is a general disbelief and isolation when the victim raises concerns through in house grievance processes. It is " institutional failure " when the victim is treated with a lack of humanity and lack of dignity at work. Hence, the victim needs to be supported through the government, parliament and petition. It benefits the UK economy and the victim both.

attributes.action: Fund adrenaline auto-injectors and training for life-threatening asthma attacks
attributes.background: Out of hospital asthma attacks kill 800 per year. News reports attest to the helplessness of parents and bystanders. At autopsy lungs are blocked with mucus plugs. Intramuscular adrenaline opens airways, reduces mucus, allows cough, and on arrival paramedics give it as part of severe asthma guidance
attributes.additional_details: President Obama's 2013 bill allowed adrenaline auto-injector use and training in schools for acute asthma and anaphylaxis with a Good Samaritan proviso. National Review of Asthma Deaths NRAD 2014 said "consider auto injectors if a patient had a previous life-threat attack or near fatal episode", which is no help in first time attacks. EpiPen, Jext, and Emerade needles pass through clothing injecting drug into thigh muscle; 2 or 3 injections may be needed. Ref. doi:10.1136/thoraxjnl-2015-207207

attributes.action: Ban gender-specific uniform policies
attributes.background:
Equality movements started being effective in the 1960's, yet we haven't seen modern equality spread to school uniform policy. 
Nobody should be expected to dress a certain way purely because of the way they were born. 
This would also help fight abuse towards transgender schoolchildren.

attributes.action: If 2nd referendum occurs, change rules. Give 16+ & expats ex uk 15 + yrs a vote.
attributes.background:
Before any new referendum Lower the voting age to 16
Allow expats out of the uk more than 15 years to have a vote
attributes.additional_details:
* The younger generation should be allowed to have a say on their own future. Not have it made for them by a much older generation.

* Expats like me, British passport , ex British army but lived in another member state, ( and have a business France for 16 years promoting and selling uk products ) were not allowed a say on such an important vote.

attributes.action: Create a cross Party committee to ensure a positive, inclusive exit from the EU
attributes.background: Many UK citizens fear that the EU exit will lead to a divided nation, governed by fear, hatred towards migrants, and a reduction in the investment in our public services. We need a moderate and progressive cross Party commitment to unity and hope. We want a urgent commitment to collaboration.
attributes.additional_details: With 48.1% of the UK population voting to remain in the EU this morning many of us have woken up to the shocking news that we are to leave the EU. We need to work together to ensure we build a positive outcome for everyone in the UK, and ensure that all Parties work collaboratively. The Government should urgently commit to a cross Party committee to oversee the implementation plan for the exit of the EU.

attributes.action: Establish Fibromyalgia clinics  to improve services for chronic pain in the Uk.
attributes.background: Fibromylgia is a chronic. syndrome affecting 1 in 20 of the population. Although it can be diagnosed easily by Rheumotologists,  GP's in local surgeries are often unable to make a diagnosis, or provide the level of medical care and support which is necessary .
attributes.additional_details:
Fibromyalgia is identified by pain in all 4 quadrants of the body, chronic fatigue and sleeping disorders. It is a complex condition involving many other symptoms from Irritable Bowel Syndrome, cognitive impairment, poor and poor co ordination to severe headaches ,Temporal Mandible Joint pain , and many others.
Providing clinics which run in a similar manner to diabetic clinics, would provide a higher standard of support for Fibromyalgia patients.These clinics are being trialled in some parts of the UK reducing trips to A and E departments,  clinic waiting times and the number of visits to a variety of other clinics.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for motorised vehicles to park or wait in cycle lanes.
attributes.background:
Cycle lanes can help increase confidence for cyclist with a designated part of the road, either by having it separate from roads of with road markings.
When vehicles park or wait in a cycle lane, it not only makes the cycle lane pointless, it actually increases the risks to cyclists.
attributes.additional_details:
A cycle lane gives a cyclist a little more confidence, especially for newer cyclists.
Cycle lanes that have vehicles in them are not only a waste of money and resources, but dangerous to cyclist and moving vehicles. 
The cyclist has to go further into the road in an area where a cycle lane was deemed to be needed.
What is the point in having cycle lanes that are unusage by cyclists because they are full of parked cars?

attributes.action: Mock vote for 16-17 year olds, on EU referendum
attributes.background: Since the referendum has caused so much distress for many people, I believe there should be a mock vote  for the youth to prove what they want for their future. Young people have had no say in the referendum, and it's time they have their voice heard.

attributes.action: Hold a General Election by May 2017 to ensure UK not governed by unelected PM
attributes.background: During the referendum the Leave campaign continually stressed that a key issue was not wanting to be governed by unelected representatives (even though EU has elected MEPs). Therefore, now there is such key work to be done, we must have a nationally elected Prime Minister, not a nominated one.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament needs to act to call a General Election before May 2017 to ensure that key decisions are taken with a true mandate. As part of this, no action should be taken by any interim prime minister to activate Article 50 of the 2009 Lisbon Treaty.

attributes.action: Adjust the status of UK residents on Tier2 ICT visa or cancel it from visa types
attributes.background: The Tier2 ICT visa is a new modern slavery, this visa status takes away all your privileges as a human. You pay equal tax as a UK resident yet because people knows that you can't stay for longer than 5 years there are many things you cant do, in my case: adopt, get a mortgage, change jobs and more
attributes.additional_details: UK government have changed the laws so that everyone who's living in UK for more than 183 days becomes a resident and pay tax, however, people in Tier2 ICT visa status do not get any benefits to the contrary, if they can't find a job outside UK within 5 years they end up paying an equal tax to a resident, stuck in a job they don't want to do (many employers abuse there ICT people because they know they own them), no bank will give you a mortgage because they can't trust what will happen to you in 5 years.

attributes.action: Ban the giving of goldfish as prizes at fairgrounds in the UK.
attributes.background: All over the UK fairgrounds and similar events are still giving away goldfish as prizes, this is an outdated practice that needs to be banned as these fish are kept in poor condition and it goes against all the work that goes into educating the public on how to properly look after their fish.
attributes.additional_details: Goldfish have a long life span, require a large volume of water to swim around in and also consume a large amount of oxygen. These fish grow to a large size when fully grown (around 36cm) and also produce a lot of waste compared to many other species available in the aquarium trade. It is universally accepted that one common goldfish needs at least 70 litres on its own with a bigger tank always being better and goldfish as prizes only adds to the problem of people thinking they are expendable.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for cars to pass horses at no more than 15mph
attributes.background: There is an increase in the number of tragic accidents caused by vehicles passing horses far too quickly and not allowing sufficient room to pass.   This can be reduced by making it a legal requirement for vehicles to pass slow and wide.

attributes.action: Change the motorway speed limit to 85 MPH.
attributes.background: The problem with motorways in UK that I find is that we have roads of good enough standard and management that could take up faster traffic.  I Really find a problem where it is allowed to go up to 60 MPH on a narrow road with sharp bends but only 70 MPH on wide and safe motorway.
attributes.additional_details:
Many other countries in europe have much higher motorway speed limit  road conditions: Belgium (74MPH), France, Austria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Poland (80 MPH), Germany (NONE - unless stated otherwise)
In some of those countries where the speed limit of 80 MPH applies the motorway road conditions are far much worse than in United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Introduce a "Trading Standards" body for politicians
attributes.background: Politicians supporting the "Leave" and "Remain" EU campaigns are now backing down from their campaign claims and promises, with no punishment. A member of the public providing misleading sales information would be subjected to fines/imprisonment. We want politicians to be subject to the same rules.
attributes.additional_details: We want an independent body to hold politicians to account.  This body should have the power to impose personal sanctions for misleading statements. These sanctions should be unlimited fines and imprisonment as can currently be imposed by Trading Standards on members of the public.  The punishment should reflect the scale and impact of the misleading statement.
